intro: Diasperus virgatus, commonly known as the Virgin's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive sap and milky latex. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with a rough texture. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
